jdrasil.graph.invariants

Class MinimalSeparator<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jdrasil.graph.invariants.Invariant<T,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Boolean>
      • jdrasil.graph.invariants.MinimalSeparator<T>

  • public class MinimalSeparator<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>>
extends Invariant<T,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Boolean>
    Computes a minimum separating vertex set, i.e. a vertex set of minimal size such that its removal splits the graph into at least two connected components. This class uses the @see Dinic algorithm and should only be called upon small graphs, as its running time is roughly \(n^3 \cdot m\).

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class jdrasil.graph.invariants.Invariant

      boolean isExact()
      Many graph invariants are NP-hard or worse, therefore it is often not possible to compute them exact.

    • Method Detail

      • computeModel

        protected java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Boolean> computeModel()
        Description copied from class: Invariant
        Compute a model of the invariant, i.e., a function that maps from vertices to the Image. This method will be invoked by the constructor and should not be called manually. As the name states, this method should do the computational task (i.e., actually computing the invariant / a model of it). This method will be called _before_ @see computeValue().
        Specified by:
        computeModel in class Invariant<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Boolean>
        Returns:

      • computeValue

        protected java.lang.Integer computeValue()
        Description copied from class: Invariant
        Compute the value of the invariant, i.e., "the invariant". This method will be invoked by the constructor and should not be called manually. As the name states, this method should do the computational task (i.e., actually computing the value). However, this method is called _after_ @see computeModel() and, therefore, the method @see getModel() is available during the evaluation of this method.
        Specified by:
        computeValue in class Invariant<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Boolean>
        Returns:

      • isExact

        public boolean isExact()
        Description copied from class: Invariant
        Many graph invariants are NP-hard or worse, therefore it is often not possible to compute them exact. A graph invariant can communicate with this method whether or not it is exact.
        Specified by:
        isExact in class Invariant<T extends java.lang.Comparable<T>,java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Boolean>
        Returns:

        Get the seperator, i.e., the model, as actual set.
